text: The name Erin [ er-in ] is an Irish and English female name. ==Origin== The name comes from the ancient name for Ireland. Erin is a name that has been utilized for both male and female individuals, although it is more frequently assigned to females. The name has its origins in Ireland and is derived from the Gaelic term "Ã‰irinn," which means "Ireland." Erin has been in use for centuries and has a profound historical and cultural significance. ==Prevalence== The name first became popular around the United States. Erin is one of the twenty most-often used female names in Wales. There are many famous people with this name. It is being used on Atlantic tropical cyclones. ==People== * Erin Brockovich, environmental activist from the United States * Erin Joyce Brady, an American model, actress and pageant winner from Connecticut ==References== Category:Given names
title: Erin
